page.title: Understanding the Raku Websites
page.description: An overview of the Raku Websites, and my suggestions for their future

content.p: I've recently done some investigation of the Raku websites, and decided it'd be useful to have a bit of a writeup on them.
It's useful to think of the new docs.raku.org (currently being developed by finanalyst) as consisting of the following pieces (layers, from bottom to top):

tr.td: To turn Rakudoc into a HTML site
The Front Page for the documentation site
finanalyst/librasteveThere has been talk about migrating this to the raku.org codebase

content.p: The advantage of this setup is that it should be possible for people to do the following:

ul.li: Create a repo with Rakudoc documentation in it
Add structure to that repo or another
Use Elucid8 to turn that into a website

content.p: This should make it possible for us to generate documentation websites for anything that's documented in Rakudoc.
It should be possible for the following sites to use this:

ul.li: Adding reference docs to sparrowhub.io -- they're currently in Markdown in the various Sparrow repos, but if they were converted to Rakudoc and put in a repo, they'd be suitable
raku.guide -- currently in adoc, but could be converted to Rakudoc
red.raku.org -- could be created from https://fco.github.io/Red/
involvement.raku.org -- this is an idea for a new site that I proposed -- see Involvement and Troupes.

content.p: It might even be possible to line things up so that, if the right info were entered into META6.json, then raku.land would generate an Elucid8 website. This could then be integrated into the raku.land page. Not every module would come with that level of documentation; most would just stick to Markdown, but for some (Cro, Red, etc), the documentation sites could be auto-generated.

tr.td: Main Raku website -- the newbie-friendly stuff
LibraSteve is working on a rebuild
Main Raku website -- the non-Newbie-Friendly stuff
Anything potentially useful that doesn't make it into LibraSteve's rebuild should be moved to involvement.raku.org
Needs an aesthetic rework. Should also be linked from either raku.org or involvement.raku.org
